Hypotheses & Specific Predictions: 1. Warmer early springs result in earlier stem growth.
- DOY25 is negatively correlated with early spring T.
- DOY50 is negatively correlated with early spring T.
- DOY75 is negatively correlated with early spring T.
2. Maximum growth rates are independent of early spring temperatures.
- Max growth rate is independent of early spring temperatures.
3. Annual stem growth responds positively to warmer spring temperatures.
- Annual growth is positively correlated with early spring temperatures.
